paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper describes a heterozygous missense mutation in the TTR gene (p.Tyr78Phe) associated with a patient presenting predominantly motor neuropathy.

patients.phenotype: predominantly motor neuropathy with mild sensory and dysautonomic signs

individual_records.phenotype_details: rapidly progressive axonal motor neuropathy, dysphagia, muscle atrophy, and fasciculations
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with increasing weakness of the lower limbs, muscle fatigue, and dysphagia, which began at the age of 59 years.

functional_data.summary: The pathogenic role of this mutation was confirmed through a sural nerve biopsy analysis, which showed a mild axonal neuropathic pattern characteristic of amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Not available; samples from parents were not available for further investigation.
variants.additional_notes: The mutation has been previously described in a single case.
key_quotes: Molecular analysis revealed the presence of the heterozygous missense mutation p.Tyr78Phe in the TTR gene.
The amyloidogenic properties of the Tyr78Phe mutation of the TTR gene have also been demonstrated by Redondo et al.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information regarding the TTR variant.
